content: Brazil                                           Map of Brazil                   states and capitals                                              T he following  map of Brazil  shows states and capital cities.   First read the questions and then have a look at the map to be able to answer them. We hope this test will be of great use to both students and people who are planning to visit Brazil (travel and tourism). We suggest visitors to read the article entitled “ Tourism in Brazil ”, below the map.     Whats the name of each of the 27 regions (26 states + 1 federal district) that appear on the map?   Taking the cursor to the capital cities , you will be able to see them as titles of the links*. Haciendo clic acceders a un mapa en el que se ha resaltado  y aparece sobreimpreso su nombre.   What are the names of their their capital cities?   Check your answers by clicking on them.                                                 *       Help  Los nombres de los estados de Brazil (en orden alfabtico) son:  Acre ;  Alagoas ;  Amapa ;  Amazonas ;  Bahia ;  Ceara ;  Espirito Santo ;  Goias ;  Maranhao ;  Mato Grosso ;  Minas Gerais ;  North Rio Grande ;  Para ;  Paraiba ;  Parana ;  Pernambuco ;  Piaui ;  Rio de Janeiro ;  Rondonia ;  Roraima ;  Saint Catarina ;  Sao Paulo ;  Sergipe ;  South Mato Grosso ;  South Rio Grande ; and  Tocantins . A stos se debe agregar el  Federal District .                                                             Tourism in Brazil      Brazil, the most extensive country and town of Latin America, is a tourist destiny chosen by travellers worldwide. In his 8,500 kilometers of coast on the Atlantic, the tourist can find from great rocky walls (like the noses of Towers, in Rio Grande of the South), to warm beaches extenssimas of waters, happening through bays, dunes and reefs of chorale. Some of the visited tourist centers more by those who they look for to enjoy the sand and the sea are: Rio de Janeiro, with its famous beaches of Ipanema and Copacabana; the archipelago Fernando de Noronha (Pernambuco), with its multiple paradisiac beaches, declared " Patrimony of the Humanidad" by the United Nations; the city of Maceio (Alagoas), between whose beaches descata the one of the Gunga, located in the mouth of the San Miguel river; and the island of Florianpolis (Santa Catherine), in which are the beaches Of the English, Canasvieiras and another 40 more. Inland, it is possible to be visited: the exhuberante amazonian forest, lodging in the city of Manaos (Amazon) or in hotels located in the same heart of the forest; the Cataracts of the Iguaz, in the limit with Argentina, near the city of Foz do Iguau (Parana); and many other natural beauties.  Collapse article       …  Expand article       Recommended                                                     castellano                             portugus                             italiano                             franais                             English                             nederlands                             deutsch                             @CAA:89                                                   'D91(J)                             -                             ,                                                         Editors notes      In this section we have already published some articles about the continents:  Europe ,  Africa ,  South America ,  Central America and the Caribbean ,  North America ,  Asia  and  Oceania .    En continente:  Brazil (South America) .     This series also includes the following filters:  Center-West Region ,  Northeast Region ,  North Region ,  South Region  and  Southeast Region .    Parques, accidentes geogrficos:  Itaimbezinho Canyon ,  View of Olinda ,  Historic Town of Ouro Preto ,  Pantanal National Park ,  Amazonia National Park ,  Jau National Park ,  Araguaia National Park ,  Tijuca National Park ,  Iguau National Park ,  Pico da Neblina ,  Serra da Canastra National Park  and  Sanctuary of Bom Jesus do Congonhas .                                            Author:  Recreational Activities Team ,  Luventicus Academy of Sciences                                 Publication Date: 30 de junio de 2004                                 Last Update: December 2nd, 2007                                                                        Suggestions                     Search for "Brazil" in our index. La habilitacin de JavaScript para navegar por nuestro sitio no conlleva riesgo alguno, incluso si la versin de su explorador no es muy reciente, y es muy recomendable en secciones tales como Viajes y Turismo, Hoteles y Galeras. Para habilitar JavaScript vaya a: Herramientas> Opciones de Internet> Seguridad> Nivel personalizado (MSIE) o a Edicin> Preferencias> Avanzadas> Scripts y Plug-ins (NN), y marque el casillero correspondiente.

No queremos inibir a criatividade mas o padro aqui adotado foi apresentado e aceito pela comunidade lusfona e deve ser seguido sempre que for possvel.   Caso tenha problemas para seguir este padro ou para derivar este trabalho entre em contato com comigo atravs do meu blog em  lorenzeto.com  ou do meu jornal  EFOMM .              Automatically translated into Arabic thanks to  WorldLingo                   1'B(* #C+1  [JHH*+(] AJ/JHG'*  9DI  [#HD] AJ/JH                                                                                           November 26, 2008 | 2:12 PM           0 comments                                                                     Tags:                                                                                                                                                    Starbucks Coffee Saves Lives                                                                                                             available in:   English  (original)  |  French  |  Spanish  |  Italian  |  German  |  Portuguese  |  Swedish  |  Russian  |  Dutch  |  Arabic                                                                        Successful companies continue to enthusiastically embrace Corporate Social Responsibility and Corporate Volunteering as  core strategies  to combat lean economic times.    I always thought self-employed had a sort of glamorous ring to it. That was until I got bored working from the house and started referring to my local Starbucks as, the office. I come here almost every day. I research, email, blog. I even hold meetings here. And yes, I do think of the Starbucks employees as my co-workers. Sigh....    But its not a bad place to claim, you know? Its no secret that Starbucks has done something right as far as business models go - I mean, most of us cant drive more than a few miles before seeing one. Lately, though, things seem to have taken a turn for the worse. Are we coming to the end of the Starbucks era?    Here are  the facts : Starbucks recently closed 600 stores in the US. They posted their  first ever loss since opening . Same-store sales are not projected to increase until 2009. The economy is unstable. Consumers are spending less. Credit is costing more. Investors are tense. The media is loud.    Is there anything Starbucks can do to bounce back? Decrease costs? Sure. Increase advertising presence? Ok. Save the world? Definitely.  Wait....  what?      Yep, amid dire projections and bleak economic conditions Starbucks continues to demonstrate leadership and keen insight. Beginning this Thanksgiving (USA) through January 2nd, Starbucks will donate five cents of all holiday beverage sales to fund Africa Aids programs. The venture is in partnership with RED and was announced a few weeks back in New Orleans at a Starbucks leadership conference.  Bono himself was on hand to announce the initiative. This coffee will be beautiful because its going to chase away the ugliness of this tiny little virus, HIV, Bono told the crowd of 10,000 store and district managers.  He continued,  (RED) is coming to a corner near you thanks to Starbucks. Im very excited to be able to say that. The business of Starbucks with roots in Africa and branches all over the world is an ideal fit for (RED). Its pretty mind-blowing to think that millions of people can buy (RED) going about their daily lives and in doing so raise millions of dollars to fight AIDS in Africa. Thats not a bad hit from your caffeine.     Besides the big-name stars lined up to lend their star power to the initiative like Mary Louise Parker and Annabella Sciorra, the most interesting piece of the campaign is the   impact calculator.   Customers are encouraged to go online and use the calculator to see how their purchases are saving lives. Talk about connecting customers/donors with outcomes.    In addition to this amazing initiative, Starbucks plans to contribute more than 1 million hours of volunteer work per year to the communities where they do business. They have also committed to increase their ethically sourced coffee purchases (including FAIR Trade) from 65 percent to 100 percent.  Each store is also working towards increasing recycling and significantly reducing water use.  (Read more about Starbucks Corporate Social Responsibility objectives).    Surprisingly, this all makes a lot of sense.  Edelman's goodpurpose.com study  of consumer attitudes surveyed 6,000 people in ten countries. They found that 82% of women and 78% of men feel it is still important for companies to support(good causes during a recession.  Also, 68% of respondents stated that they would remain loyal to a brand that supported a good cause even during a recession.    Corporate Social Responsibility is no longer a charitable nicety. It is a  winning strategy to strengthen the bottom line.    So watch for the commercials to start this Friday. Oh, and if youre reading this in your own local Starbucks (ahem....the office), take a look at the front window:  ( 11/28 )  Thats what Im talking about.                               Le caf de Starbucks sauve les vies                  Automatically translated into French thanks to  WorldLingo                   Les compagnies russies continuent  embrasser avec enthousiasme la responsabilit et offrir de corporation As  stratgies de noyau  pour combattre des priodes conomiques maigres.    J'ai toujours pens que indpendant a eu une sorte d'anneau fascinant  elle. C'tait jusqu' ce que j'aie obtenu le fonctionnement ennuyeux de la maison et aie commenc  mentionner mon Starbucks local comme, le bureau. Je viens ici presque journalier. Je recherche, email, blog. Je tiens mme des runions ici. Et oui, je pense aux employs de Starbucks en tant que mes collgues. Soupir….    Mais ce n'est pas un mauvais endroit  rclamer, savez-vous ? Ce n'est aucun secret que Starbucks a fait quelque chose bien dans la mesure o les modles d'affaires disparaissent - je veux dire, la plupart d'entre nous ne peux pas conduire plus que quelques milles avant de voir un. Rcemment, bien que, les choses semblent avoir pris un tour pour le plus mauvais. Arrivons-nous  la fin de l're de Starbucks ?    Voici  les faits : Starbucks a rcemment ferm 600 magasins aux USA. Ils ont signal le leur  premire perte depuis l'ouverture . Mme-stockez les ventes ne sont pas projets d'augmenter jusqu'en 2009. L'conomie est instable. Les consommateurs dpensent moins. Le crdit cote plus. Les investisseurs sont tendus. Les mdias est fort.    Y a-t-il que quelque chose Starbucks peut-il faire pour rebondir ? Diminuez les cots ? Sr. Augmentez annoncer la prsence ? Ok. conomiser le monde ? Certainement.  Attente….  ce qui ?      Ouais, parmi de grandes projections et conditions conomiques mornes Starbucks continue  dmontrer la conduite et la perspicacit vive. Commenant ce thanksgiving (Etats-Unis) jusqu'au 2 janvier, Starbucks donnera cinq cents de toutes les ventes de boisson de vacances aux programmes de secours de l'Afrique de fonds. L'entreprise est dans l'association avec le ROUGE et a t annonce quelques semaines en arrire  la Nouvelle-Orlans  une confrence de conduite de Starbucks.  Bono lui-mme devait en main annoncer l'initiative. Ce caf sera beau parce qu'il va chasser loin la laideur de ce petit virus minuscule, HIV, Bono a dit la foule de 10.000 directeurs de magasin et de zone.  Il a continu, (ROUGE) vient  un proche faisant le coin vous grce  Starbucks. Je suis trs excit pour pouvoir dire cela. Les affaires de Starbucks avec des racines en Afrique et des branches sont partout dans le monde un ajustement idal pour (ROUGE). Il est assez hallucinant pour penser que les millions de personnes peuvent acheter (ROUGE) aborder leurs vies quotidiennes et de cette manire soulever des millions de dollars pour combattre le SIDA en Afrique. Ce n'est pas un mauvais coup de votre cafine.     Sans compter que le grand-nom tient le premier rle align pour prter le leur tiennent le premier rle la puissance  l'initiative comme Mary Louise Parker et Annabella Sciorra, le morceau le plus intressant de la campagne est  “ calculatrice d'impact. ”  Des clients sont encourags  aller en ligne et  utiliser la calculatrice pour voir comment leurs achats sont les vies d'conomie. Parlez des clients/des donateurs se reliants avec des rsultats.    En plus de cette initiative tonnante, Starbucks projette contribuer plus de 1 million d'heures de travail volontaire par an aux communauts o elles font des affaires. Livro: Nova's GMAT Prep Course (com CD ROM) - Jeff Kolby    200 visitas desde 12/03/2008  15h47. Usuio cadastrado desde 26/07/2007.                          Livro: Nova's GMAT Prep Course (com CD ROM) - Jeff Kolby  The authors tell you up front: "The GMAT is not easy--nor is this book." While that may seem daunting, the test is challenging for a reason, and if you want to get into the top business schools, you'll need to excel in a very competitive field. If you're willing to work hard, the GMAT Prep Course will show you the ropes and get you to score your best. Its refreshing, no-nonsense style reflects the authors' insistence that it is hard work, not tricks or insider knowledge, that brings success.  An orientation chapter sets the scene and guides you through the basics of what you'll find inside: overviews of each test section (including the essays) with lots of sample questions and in-depth analyses of correct and incorrect answers. No frills here, just lots of practice and some general help with the types of questions you should expect, such as analogies and data sufficiency. While some readers might miss the flashy design or eye-catching logos of the competitors, the authors maintain that attention and diligence are all that's needed to beat the GMAT. If you're up to the challenge, get the GMAT Prep Course and start burning the midnight oil.     Book Description    Every year students pay $1,000 and more to test prep companies to prepare for the GMAT . Now you can get the same preparation in a book. GMAT Prep Course provides the equivalent of a 2-month, 50-hour course.    Although the GMAT is a difficult test, it is a very learnable test. GMAT Prep Course presents a thorough analysis of the GMAT and introduces numerous analytic techniques that will help you immensely, not only on the GMAT but in business school as well.    Features:    Math: Twenty-two chapters provide comprehensive review of GMAT math.    Logical Reasoning: Discover the underlying simplicity of these problems and learn the tactics the GMAT writers use to obfuscate the answers.    Reading Comprehension: Develop the ability to spot places from which questions are likely to be drawn as you read a passage (pivotal words, counter-premises, etc.).    Sentence Correction: Comprehensive review of GMAT grammar.    Mentor Exercises: These exercises provide hints, insight, and partial solutions to ease your transition from seeing GMAT problems solved to solving them on your own.    Also includes a comprehensive, Free online Course!    Course Features:    Ask Questions! Our instructors monitor StudyDesk to answer your questions. StudyDesk also records the step where you make a mistake or ask a question. This is just one of many powerful educational tools in StudyDesk.    Highly Interactive: You can search the course for any topic, take notes, view solutions, view reports, and each time you return to the course it presents the last topic you were studying.    Versatile: You can access the course from any computer at any time.    Statistics: Your performance on the exercises and tests is saved and you may review your performance and check solutions at any time. Also, you can check your ranking based on all students taking the course.    Also includes GMAT test prep software!    Software features:     Mentor Mode: In Mentor Mode, you are immediately told whether you answered a problem correctly, and you can immediately view a detailed solution of the problem.    Test Mode: In Test Mode, you can take a GMAT test timed and scored by the program. THE ALQUEVA DAM WILL DESTROY ROCK ART IN PORTUGAL    The Guadiana river (Portugal-Spain borderline) is endangered. A new   Coa-like international rock-art case is growing up. Within the next months   a huge 80 km long "lake" will submerge the area of the Guadiana river,   between Spain and Portugal. It is the Alqueva dam: once again a damned dam   is menacing environment and culture.  A very important rock art area (Cheles, Badajoz de la Frontera, Spain) with   hundreds of engraved rocks and thousands of figures has been yet discovered   and studied by an experienced Spanish team of archaeologists. The complex   seems to present Neolithic-Chalcolithic patterns, with some   Paleo-Mesolithic figures. The announcement was given in the 5th Prehistoric   Art course led in April 2001 by the Instituto Politecnico de Tomar   (Portugal). Many figures are very similar to the Tagus valley rocks   (Portugal): as these last are by some 30 years under the water of the   Fratel dam, the Guadiana complex represents at this moment a unique   occasion to study the Neolithic-Chalcolithic Iberian open air rock art.  All environmental conditions let us think that many other rock art areas   are present, also in the Portuguese side. In fact few days ago (25.4.2001)   a 10 km long area has been discovered but not yet officially announced in   the Portuguese side by the environmental movement "Cota 139" (139 is the   altitude level of the dam). Once again it is confirmed that in the Iberian   peninsula rivers represent an archaeological area of main importance.  The problem is that the Alqueva dam is already built. So we can well   understand that our heritage is considered by a restricted group of   technicians a property of the present and not, as it is indeed, a gift for   the future.  Archaeologists and rock art scholars can't be silent no more, and must pose   some questions. First of all: which kind of archaeological surveys has been   conducted before building the dam? Second: as the Coa river rock art was   already known, why the Portuguese Institute of Archaeology didn't undertake   a rock art related research in the area? Or better, if this survey has been   conducted, why nothing was "officially" discovered? And finally: as there   is in Portugal a National rock art Institute (CNART), created after and   thanks to the Coa saving movement, why no official announcement has been   given about a so important rock art area? Did they look for it? Once again   the history of Portuguese rock art risks to be transformed into the history   of a hidden underwater rock art, as the Tagus rock art teaches, good to   print books, but not good enough to try to change the situation, with the   unique great exception of the Coa Valley rock art saving movement. We can't   no more accept this conduct and this situation.  This TRACCE special issue is an open number, a work in progress. You are   all kindly invited to expose your point of view, your suggestions, your   "news" into the "Guadiana river" forum, and/or to send news, papers and   pictures: we hope it will contribute to obtain a significant result.         ---------------------------------------  Mr. Andrea Arca' - Footsteps of Man   http://www.rupestre.net      TRACCE 13 is online  Special issue devoted to the Guadiana Rock Art   http://rupestre.net/tracce/13/    Guadiana rock art forum   http://www.voy.com/28087/    ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------              THREAT TO ROCK ART IN THE GUADIANA,(PORTUGAL AND SPAIN)         Thursday, 3 May 2001    Rock-Art Discovery in the Alqueva Dam Zone of the River Guadiana in Spain and Portugal    The International Federation of Rock Art Organizations applauds the important discovery of rock-engravings by the river Guadiana in Spain and Portugal, in a zone that will be flooded by the Alqueva dam.    A Spanish archaeologist disclosed the rock engravings in Spain early last April at a course on European prehistoric art, held at the Polytechnic of Tomar (IPT) in Portugal. His talk was on fieldwork carried out at Cheles during January and February this year.    IFRAO rock-art researchers promptly went to Cheles and confirmed the importance of the discovery. The Spanish archaeologist sent them a report, which they forwarded to the president of the Federation.    An absence of similar engravings further downstream in Portugal puzzled the researchers. There was not any presentation about engravings like these at last February's archaeology colloquium of the Alqueva Development and Infrastructure Enterprise (EDIA), the agency building the dam that also handles the archaeology and other impact studies.    Then the  Liga para a Proteco da Natureza  (LPN), a nature protection league founded in 1948, received an anonymous tip-off about engravings just like those of Cheles, except they were spread along ten kilometres by the Guadiana river in Portugal.    In response, members of  Movimento Cota 139 , a movement aiming to limit the level of the Alqueva dam reservoir level to 139 metres, went to see the engravings on Wednesday 25 April (Portugal's Liberty Day) and called in Manuel Calado, an archaeologist from the University of Lisbon.    An environmental Web site called  Ambiente Online  broke the news of the engravings on Thursday evening, 26 April. Next morning, the rest of the Portuguese mass media pounced on the scoop.    Position of IFRAO    Although people from the international scientific community are delighted by the discovery, they are also very concerned because the dam is nearly finished and it will be difficult to avoid the destruction of this important rock-art area.    IFRAO, with thousands of amateurs and specialists on five continents that belong to the Federation's organisations, now calls for the prompt nomination of a genuinely independent international commission to follow the situation and ensure international participation in the exploration and documentation of the rock-art area.    The Federation considers the plight of the Guadiana rock-art area to be far worse than that of the C rock-art area, in Portugal, in 1994-5 for the following reasons: -    Work on the dam is nearing completion.    It seems that the lesson of C dam was completely forgotten, resulting in an appalling threat to or loss of the rock-art and a massive burden on citizens and taxpayers that pay the colossal cost of such mistaken projects.    Today there are bodies that did not exist in 1994: IPA (Instituto Portugu de Arqueologia), the Portuguese Institute of Archaeology; and CNART (Centro Nacional de Arte Rupestre), the National Centre of Rock-Art. These bodies are responsible for keeping an inventory and register of all rock-art in the country and advancing the conservation and public awareness of it (law no. 117/97, 14 May 1997).    IPA and CNART should have been constantly inspecting what EDIA was doing. As the current president of IPA, Prof. Dr. Jo Zilh, was severely critical of a similar situation during the fight to save the C rock-art area, IFRAO fails to understand why he does not resign-so showing his total opposition to the destruction of the Guadiana rock-art area.    IFRAO upholds the protection, study, and public awareness of rock-art on all continents, irrespective of its age or connected traditions. We are therefore once again deeply concerned that an attributed age is once again being used as criteria in determining the importance of rock-art and whether or not it is worth protecting.    Rock-art areas like the Guadiana, stretching two kilometres in Spain and ten in Portugal, are always of great value and importance. If claims that most of the engravings are Neolithic (New Stone Age) prove to be true, this corpus would be quite rare because there is very little rock-art in Europe attributed as Neolithic-Chalcolithic (Copper and Stone Age). Corresponding epochs only exist in Valcamica, Italy (UNESCO World Heritage Site) and Mont Bego, France.    Position of IFRAO (ctd)    IFRAO asks the Prime Minister and Minister of the Culture in Portugal to consider the following points: -    A need for timely action to do everything possible to investigate the engravings with the most appropriate and up-to-date methodology and with adequate time to do so, even if this means delaying or suspending the filling of the dam reservoir.    The merit of creating a genuinely independent international commission to assess the importance and value of the rock-art. Aside from questions over the competence of IPA, CNART and EDIA, the commission should not fall under these or other state bodies-thus helping to ensure the integrity of the commission is not compromised.    State bodies cannot be both players and referees. This was one of the most heavily criticised aspects of the C syndrome.    IFRAO has formed an emergency delegation with specialists from four continents to follow the situation. It would be extremely beneficial if this delegation were part of an enlarged commission with representatives of Portuguese universities, archaeology associations and other groups.    IFRAO can promptly indicate suitable specialists to organise training courses for all the archaeologists and students who will be needed for the tremendous effort a time sensitive investigation requires.    We remember the political courage shown by the Prime Minister, Antio Guterres, in saving the C rock-art area. To enable constructive dialogue, IFRAO requests an audience with the Prime Minister and his Excellency, the President of Portugal.    Finally, IFRAO wants to tell people in Portugal they can and should be proud of this discovery.    When people respect the past, there is hope for the future.    ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------               A posio da IFRAO perante as descobertas em Alqueva      Comunicado da IFRAO - a Federaco Internacional das Organizacoes de Arte Rupestre - referente 'as recentes descobertas em Alqueva. E' um documento extenso que portanto sintetizamos sumariamente:              * Congratulacao pelas descobertas feitas em     Espanha e em Portugal        * Nomeacao imediata de uma comiss     internacional de acompanhamento verdadeiramente independente.        * Demissao dos responsaveis do IPA e do     CNART que nao tomaram mediadas para evitar outro Coa, nao verificarando o trabalho levado     a cabo pela EDIA.        * Participacao internacional do esforco de     prospeccao, levantamento e estudo das gravuras rupestres do rio Guadiana                Comunicado    Alqueva - A descoberta das gravuras rupestre na margem portuguesa do em Guadiana     A IFRAO (Federao Internacional das Organizaes de Arte Rupestre) congratula-se com a importante descoberta efectuada por membros do  Movimento Cota 139,  em colaborao do arqueogo Manuel Calado da Universidade de Lisboa. Mas se por um lado a descoberta de gravuras rupestre no rio Guadiana motivo para n de grande regozijo ela tamb por parte da comunidade cientifica internacional motivo de grande preocupao. Sendo a construo da barragem irreversel, a destruio de t importantes achados praticamente inevitel.         Perante tal circunstcia a IFRAO, em nome de milhares de especialistas e amadores espalhados pelos 5 continentes—sios das associaes membros da nossa federao—, vem tornar plico os seguintes pontos:     1 A IFRAO teve conhecimento da existcia de gravuras rupestres na margem espanhola do rio Guadiana (na zona afecta pelo regolfo de Alqueva) no inio de Abril, em Tomar, durante o Curso de Arte Prhistica Europeia realizado pelo IPT. Nomeadamente quanto o colega espanhol Hipolito Collado fez apresentao plica dos estudos realizados em Janeiro e Fevereiro deste ano. No seguimento de tal comunicao a IFRAO, representada por Mila Sims de Abreu, Ludwig Jaffe, Andrea Arce Angelo Fossati (estes timos da Itia) deslocaram-se zona de Cheles (Oliven) onde constataram a importcia de tal descoberta. Foi solicitado ent ao colega espanhol um relatio que posteriormente foi enviado ao Presidente da IFRAO. Em tal ocasi os representantes da IFRAO n deixaram de se interrogar sobre a auscia de descobertas no lado portugu. Um de n (MSA) esclareceu os colegas estrangeiros que todo o processo da minimizao do patrimio arqueolico estava a ser coordenado pela EDIA e que atent nenhum comunicado tinha sido feita sobre quaisquer gravuras desse tipo.    2 A IFRAO veio agora, tal como a maioria dos portugueses, a ter conhecimento atrav dos mia, da existcia de gravuras rupestres, em territio portugu, numa no extens de pelo menos 10 Km idticas as de Cheles,    Perante tais factos a IFRAO n pode deixar de constatar que alguma coisa correu profundamente errada neste processo e esclarece os seguintes pontos.                - A situao presente em Alqueva bem diversa—talvez mais grave e     escandalosa—que a de Foz C porque:          A barragem estem fase avanda de construo.          Parece que a lio da barragem do Foz Coa foi completamente esquecida com     enorme prejuo para o patrimio rupestre e para os contribuintes portugueses que v     ter que pagar a factura desses erros.          Existe hoje – coisa que n acontecia em 1994 - um Instituto Portugu de     Arqueologia (IPA) e um Centro Nacional de Arte Rupestre responsel exactamente     "pelo inventariar e registar (…) todos os sios rupestres existentes em     territio nacional promovendo a sua conservao e divulgao". (Decreto-lei     n17/97 de 14 de Maio). Estes organismos plicos deviam ter acompanhado o que se     passava e controlado o trabalho desenvolvido pela EDIA. A IFRAO, conhecendo das posies     assumidas, no caso de Foz C, pelo actual Presidente do IPA, Prof. Dr. Jo Zilh,     n entende como que ele, que tanto criticou o IPPAR em circunstcias semelhantes,     n se tenha imediatamente demitido – demonstrando assim, como quando foi do C a     total oposio destruio de arte rupestre: Surpreende-nos tamb a incapacidade     por parte do IPA de evitar situaes como estas. Mais grave e’ o facto do prrio     Presidente do IPA vir a plico dizer que "era previsel" .O que fez ent     para prever tal facto? Quando ao coordenador do CNART, que estava como n, presente em     Tomar e que portanto ouviu o colega espanhol, demonstra mais uma vez falta de oportunidade     e responsabilidade pois nada fez durante estas ultimas semanas para verificar a tal     "previsel" presen em lado portugu de gravuras rupestres. A sua     anunciada visita para segunda-feira, peca, portanto, pelo menos, por considerel     atraso…          A IFRAO, tal como sempre o faz, promove o estudo, a proteco e a divulgao     da arte rupestre, em todos os continentes, seja qual for a oca ou cultura a pertencam.     Ficamos portanto mais uma vez profundamente muito preocupados com a noo de a idade das     gravuras seja motivo ou n da sua destruio. Lamentamos que o Presidente do IPA tenha     vindo a plico, mesmo antes de ter visitado o local, e pior ainda, reconhecendo que     nenhum estudo tenha sido ainda feito, dizer "as gravuras s menos importantes que     as do C". Como pode como arqueogo afirmar tal coisa se nem se quer se sabe     ainda dimens e extens dos achados?          E’ ainda importante recordar que zonas de arte rupestre com tal dimens     (10km em Portugal 2 Km em Espanha) s sempre de grande valor e importcia. Se se vier     a confirmar que as gravuras s na verdade neolicas esta descoberta torna-se ainda     mais importante porque, contrariamente ao que muitos parecem quer dizer, existe um nero     muito reduzido de rochas gravadas entre o Neolico-Calcolico na Europa.     Correspondendo tal perdo, por exemplo,  primeiras fases de Valcamica (Itia -     monumento UNESCO) e do Monte Bego (Fran)             A IFRAO vai enviar ao Sr. Primeiro Ministro e ao Ministro da Cultura um documento em que vai pedir que:        1 - Seja feita uma imediata interveno no sentido que tudo     seja feito para que as gravuras sejam estudadas da forma mais adequada e pelo perdo de     tempo que seja necessio --mesmo que para tal seja necessio adiar ou suspender o     enchimento da barragem..                 2 - Criar uma comiss de acompanhamento dos trabalhos verdadeiramente     independente de modo que se possa avaliar a sua importcia e valor. Para que tal     comiss seja completamente independente e sem qualquer tipo de presss pensamos que     seja indispensel que N fam parte dela nem a EDIA nem t pouco nenhum dos     organismos do estado envolvidos (IPA -CNART). N sporque demonstraram uma clara     incapacidade de actuao mas tamb para garantir a total transparcia. A comunidade     internacional n iricompreender que organismos do Estado Portugu sejam ao mesmo     tempo, os executantes e os controladores. Essa quest foi ali uma das mais criticadas     durante Foz C e que acabou por conduzir a criao de uma comiss de especialistas     externos. A IFRAO criou juma comiss de emergcia constitua por especialistas de     4 continentes que v acompanhar o desenrolar da situao. Pensamos seria extremamente     positivo se a comiss da IFRAO fizesse parte de uma comiss alargada do Governo, por     exemplo, com representantes das Universidades Portuguesas, das associaes     arqueolica, nomeadamente a APA (Associao Profissional dos Arqueogos)          3 - Que sejam apuradas responsabilidade no que diz respeitos aos trabalhos     arqueolicos efectuados durante os timos anos. Que demita – visto que ele n     teve a coragem de o fazer - o coordenador do Centro Nacional de Arte Rupestre (CNART),     principal responsel polico (pecando em n controlar os trabalhos desenvolvidos     pela EDIA) do que se passou ataqui.                 4 - A IFRAO coloca a disposio do Estado Portugu os seus   investigadores e salienta que pode enviar, em curto espa de tempo especialistas que   colaborar com as autoridades portuguesas e que est preparado para promover cursos de   treino para arqueogos e estudantes que estejam disponeis para ajudar no enorme   esfor que o estudo – principalmente se conduzido contra o tempo – vai   representar.      5 - A IFRAO, n esquecendo a coragem polica demonstrada   pelo Sr. Primeiros Ministro Eng. Antio Guterres, perante o caso do C est   interessada em dialogar de foram construtiva com as autoridades portuguesas. Vamos   portanto solicitar uma audicia ao Sr. Primeiro-ministro e a Sua Excelcia, o Sr.   Presidente da Replica.           Por fim, queremos dizer a todos os Portugueses: - esta uma descoberta que deverser motivo de orgulho para Portugal.    So' um povo que olha com respeito para o Passado pode olhar com esperan para o Futuro!          Links                     CeSMAP Centro   Studi e Museo di Arte Preistorica - IFRAO official     web page - Descobertas gravuras rupestres na ea do Alqueva -     PLICO Online, Friday April 27 2001       http://ultimahora.publico.pt/shownews.asp?idCanal=36&id=20647                    - Figuras Rupestres Descobertas no Vale do Guadiana - by     Carlos Dias - PLICO, Saturday 28 April 2001       http://jornal.publico.pt/publico/2001/04/28/Terra/THCAPA01.html               "Instituto Portugu de Arqueologia e Centro Nacional     de Arte Rupestre acusados de negligenciar Alqueva" PLICO Online, Saturday 28     April, 2001       http://ultimahora.publico.pt/shownews.asp?id=20913&idCanal=14               - Descobertas de Arte Rupestre no Guadiana - Instituto     Portugu de Arqueologia (N.B., large picture files slows page loading)       http://www.ipa.min-cultura.pt/news/noticias/DecGuad               -  Liga para a Proteco da     Natureza  (LPN), a nature protection league founded in 1948       http://www.lpn.pt              ---------------------------------------   Mila Sims de Abreu    Representante em Portugal da IFRAO    (Universidade de Tr-os-Montes e Alto – Unidade de Arqueologia do Dep. de Geologia)     Contactos    E-mail :  msabreu@utad.pt    ICQ# 8134563    Telf: 254 920921    (Sdurante os dias de semana)    Telm 962955608    Tel. 259 350179    Cell Phone: 96 295 56 08 (weekdays only)    ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------              EUROPEAN PROJECT:  PAST SIGNS AND PRESENT MEMORIES         Saturday, 5 May 2001    Statement      The recent discovery of an important prehistoric art complex in the Iberian Peninsula, in the Guadiana valley, imposes itself as a reason for joy, but also for concern, from the archaeologists and European citizens.     This discovery is of a major relevance for Europe, and it must be studied and protected. This last few years, in Europe, our vision of prehistoric art has experienced unexpected discoveries. This was the case of the Chauvet and Cosquer caves in France, that led us to rethink themes, styles and chronologies. It was, namely, the case of the archaeological complex of Foz Coa in Portugal, that generated a new perspective of Palaeolithic art, revealing that the upper Palaeolithic men decided to humanise the whole landscape, and that art was a human expression as strong in the open air than it was in caves. A reality confirmed now in other areas, like further south, near the Tagus river (the Ocreza valley, where an archaeological park is being organised).    It is the case, now, of the archaeological complex of Guadiana, in Spain and Portugal, which is still poorly known, but benefits from a very detailed contextualisation, product of several years of intensive research over many sites, from the Palaeolithic to the Bronze age.     The carvings of Guadiana enable us to better understand the relation of prehistoric art with its wider cultural context. It is also the opportunity to review the artistic cycles of the great rivers of western Iberia, of which the major Tagus complex remains under an artificial lake for the last 27 years. The Guadiana may be related to the Tagus complex, at the level of the art, but also of the middle Holocene sites, thus casting new light on the issues related to the origins of agro-pastoralism in the Iberian Peninsula.    The systematic study of this reality has an importance that goes beyond the national frontiers, and imposes itself as essential for the understanding of how, in this zone of Europe, and through a long and diversified sequence of periods, has been produced the artistic expression of people that lived there, while the major prehistoric sacred areas of our continent were carved, as the Mont Bego in France, Valcamonica in Italy, the Boyne valley in Ireland or Bohuslaan in Sweden.    To better understand this reality and to present it to the wider public is a responsibility of prehistorians, namely in the context of building the European Union of cultures and citizens. The project "Past Signs and Present memories", that integrates the undersigned institutions, addresses this responsibility, through building a network of data-bases on European Prehistoric Art and its dissemination, with the support of the European Commission (Programme Culture 2000).    The partners in the project, meeting in Ravello (Italy), take the decision to contact the responsibles for the Guadiana valley research, offering the projects’ resources and their collaboration for the various stages of work. In particular, we may integrate the results of the research in the European data-base on -line, thus contributing for its fast dissemination.    Being aware that the complex will be submerged by an artificial lake, we consider that the European prehistoric art researchers should collaborate with their Portuguese and Spanish colleagues in the intensive study and possible rescue of the threatened complex, reinforcing the national teams already in place. We consider this not to be a task for small teams or for a too short period of time.    W e estimate that the Portuguese government, who is responsible for building the dam, and has to its credit having saved the complex of Foz Coa, will understand that the Guadiana, from an European perspective, has a similar dimension and importance. Even if the dam is, apparently, irreversible, it’s fundamental that the art be studied by multidisciplinary and international teams, for the matters of recording and comparing the complex in its European framework, before it may be submerged.     We also consider that the company building the dam (EDIA) should enable the rock art studies to be pursued with time and resources to the level of this discovery, namely by reinforcing the budget available.    This is our duty as Europeans , since memory remains the major basis for European identity, and its preservation is not to be dissociated from the building of the European Union.    Agreed and signed in Ravello, May the 5 th , 2001          ----------------------------------------  Luiz OOSTERBEEK -  INSTITUTO POLITECNICO DE TOMAR (Portugal)  loost@ipt.pt      Hipolito COLLADO GIRALDO - ASOCIACION CULTURAL COLECTIVO BARBAON (Spain)  hipolitocollado@ozu.es    Juan Manuel VICENT GARCIA -  DEPARTAMENTO DE PREHISTORIA, INSTITUTO DE HISTORIA DEL C.S.I.C. Guidelines for sites linking to mayoclinic.org            Transporte e hospedagem                 Aéreo   O Aeroporto Internacional de Jacksonville ( Jacksonville International Airport ) está situado à cerca de 30 milhas (menos de 50 quilômetros) a Noroeste da Mayo Clinic – de 45 minutos a uma hora de carro.     Quase todas as empresas aéreas dos EUA servem Jacksonville (Flórida), a partir de Miami (Flórida), Atlanta (Georgia) e Nova Iorque. Nessas cidades, são feitas a maioria das conexões com vôos internacionais, como os vindos do Brasil, Portugal e outros países.     No próprio aeroporto, você pode encontrar serviços de transporte gratuito para hotéis e motéis, bem como para locadoras de automóvel. No aeroporto, você pode encontrar também os seguintes serviços:    Aluguel de carro   Táxi   Vans adaptadas para transporte de cadeira de rodas   Limosines   Cadeiras de rodas   Ambulância aérea   Balcão de informações    Ônibus   Jacksonville é servida pelas linhas de ônibus da  Greyhound/Trailways  (site em inglês). A rodoviária fica no centro da cidade, a cerca de 15 milhas (24 quilômetros) da clínica. Telefone: (800) 231-2222.     Trem   Jacksonville é servida pelo sistema  Amtrak . A estação ferroviária fica no lado Oeste da cidade, a cerca de 18 milhas (27 quilômetros) da clínica. Telefones: (800) 872-7245 (dos EUA) ou (904) 766-5110 e (904) 766-5128.     Para mais informações sobre transporte, visite  www.jaa.aero/    Hospedagem em Jacksonville   Embora a Msyo Clinic disponha, na recepção, de informações sobre hospedagem em Jacksonville, é recomendável que reservas sejam feitas com antecedência. A clínica pode cuidar da hospedagem de pacientes e familiares.     Muitos estabelecimentos de Jacksonville oferecem descontos aos pacientes da Mayo e suas famílias. Para esse fim, certifique-se de mencionar a Mayo Clinic ao fazer a reserva.     Existem dois  hotéis no campus da Mayo Clinic:     O hotel  The Inn at Mayo Clinic  dispõe de 78 suítes de um ou dois quartos com estúdios e cozinha. Ele está conectado à clínica por uma passarela aclimatizada. Para reservas ou mais informações, telefone para (888) 255-4458 (dos EUA) ou para (904) 992-9992; envie fax pelo número (904) 992-4463.   O hotel  Courtyard by Marriott  está ao lado da clínica. Seu restaurante oferece café da manhã completo, almoço e jantar, de segunda à sexta-feira. As reservas podem ser feitas por telefone, pelos números (800) 321-2211 (em inglês) ou (800) 489-2500 (em espanhol); também podem ser feitas  reservas online  no site www.marriott.com.     Para mais informações sobre hotéis e motéis em Jacksonville, St. Augustine e na área da praia, visite os seguintes sites:     Jacksonville and the Beaches Convention and Visitors Bureau   St. Augustine, Ponte Vedra & the Beaches Convention and Visitors Bureau   A Mayo Clinic não tem afiliação ou qualquer tipo de relacionamento comercial com hotéis fora de seu campus. Guidelines for sites linking to mayoclinic.org            Direções                    Jacksonville Highway Map  (PDF)         Como Chegar à Mayo Clinic   4500 San Pablo Road  Jacksonville, FL – 32224    Do Aeroporto   Você sairá do aeroporto pela Airport Road. Siga os sinais que indicam I-95 (Interstate 95), por uns 3 quilômetros. Pegue a rampa da I-95 South; Da saída do aeroporto, como quem vem do Norte, você vai dirigir por mais 19 milhas (30,5 km) em direção Sul, rumo à "Downtown Jacksonville" (centro). Na saída 344 (Exit 344), pegue a J. Turner Butler Boulevard (202), em direção às praias (East). Siga pelo Butler por cerca de 9 milhas (14,5 km), até chegar à San Pablo Road – você já vai ver uma placa da Mayo Clinic à sua direita. No sinal luminoso, vire à esquerda (na San Pablo Rd.). A Mayo está  adiante a 400 metros de distância.    Do Sul (de Miami, Orlando, etc.)   Para vir de carro de Miami para Jacksonville, você pode pegar a I-95 (Interstate 95) ou a State Road A1A (ver abaixo). Se vier de Orlando, pegue a I-4 (Interstate 4) Leste (East), em direção a Daytona Beach.  A I-4 o levará a I-95, na qual você deve tomar a direção Norte (North). Dirija por cerca de uma hora e meia, até a saída 344 (exit 344) e tome a J. Turner Butler Boulevard (202), em direção às praias (East). Siga pela Butler por cerca de 9 milhas (14,5 km), até chegar à San Pablo Road – você já vai ver uma placa da Mayo Clinic à sua direita. No sinal luminoso, vire à esquerda (na San Pablo Rd.). A Mayo está novamente a 400 metros de distância.    Pelo Caminho das Praias (de Miami, etc.)   Se você dirigir pela State Road A1A, próxima às praias, saia na J. Turner Butler Boulevard (202) e dirija em direção Oeste (West) até a San Pablo Road. Vire à direita e dirija até a entrada da clínica.    No Campus da Mayo Clinic   Ao chegar à Mayo Clinic, siga a rua principal e vá direto para o campus. O estacionamento é gratuito dentro do "Patient Parking Lots" A, B e C. A garagem, perto do "Davis Building" é paga, a não ser que você tenha uma licença especial.    Tente estacionar perto do prédio onde sua consulta será realizada. Cadeiras de rodas estão disponíveis nas entradas principais dos prédios Davis, Mayo e Cannaday.    Se for se hospedar no "The Inn at Mayo Clinic", faça a primeira direita ao entrar no campus da Mayo e siga os sinais. Se for ficar no "Courtyard by Marriott", vire à esquerda no primeiro "stop sign" (placa de parada obrigatória) e siga os sinais, depois de entrar no campus da Mayo. Satlite natural          De Wikipedia, la enciclopedia libre                 Saltar a  navegacin ,  bsqueda                 Comparacin de La Tierra con las lunas ms importantes de cada planeta del Sistema Solar       Se denomina  satlite natural  a cualquier objeto que  orbita  alrededor de un  planeta . Generalmente el satlite es mucho ms pequeo y acompaa al planeta en su evolucin alrededor de la  Estrella  que orbite (si orbita alguna).   En el caso de la  Luna , tiene una masa tan similar a la masa de la  Tierra  que podra considerarse como un sistema de dos  planetas  que orbitan juntos ( sistema binario de planetas ). Tal es el caso de  Plutn  y su satlite  Caronte . Si dos objetos poseen masas similares, se suele hablar de  sistema binario  en lugar de un objeto primario y un satlite. El criterio habitual para considerar un objeto como satlite es que el  centro de masas  del sistema formado por los dos objetos est dentro del objeto primario. El punto ms elevado de la rbita del satlite se conoce como  apopside .   En el  Sistema Solar , los nombres de los satlites son personajes de la mitologa, excepto los de  Urano  que son personajes de diferentes obras de  William Shakespeare .   Por extensin se llama  lunas  a los satlites de otros planetas. Se dice  los cuatro satlites de  Jpiter , pero tambin,  las cuatro lunas de  Jpiter . Tambin por extensin se llama  satlite natural  o  luna  a cualquier cuerpo natural que gira alrededor de un cuerpo celeste, aunque no sea un  planeta , como es el caso de la  luna asteroidal  Dactyl girando alrededor del  asteroide   (243) Ida  etc.           Contenido       1   Clasificacin de los satlites en el Sistema Solar   2   Satlites en el Sistema Solar     2.1   Tierra   2.2   Marte   2.3   Jpiter   2.4   Saturno   2.5   Urano   2.6   Neptuno   2.7   Plutn   2.8   (136199) Eris   2.9   Haumea                   [ editar ]   Clasificacin de los satlites en el Sistema Solar          rbita satelital              Anillos del satlite saturnino Rea.       En el  Sistema Solar  se puede clasificar los satlites segn:     Satlites pastores : Cuando mantienen algn  anillo  de Jpiter, Saturno, Urano o Neptuno en su lugar.   Satlites troyanos : Cuando un planeta y un satlite importante tienen en los  puntos de Lagrange  L 4  y L 5  otros satlites.   Satlites coorbitales : Cuando giran en la misma rbita. Los satlites troyanos son coorbitales, pero tambin lo son los satlites de Saturno  Jano  y  Epimeteo  que distan en sus rbitas menos de su tamao y en vez de chocar intercambian sus rbitas.   Satlites asteroidales : Algunos  asteroides  tienen satlites a su alrededor como  (243) Ida  y su satlite Dactyl. El  10 de agosto  de  2005  se anunci el descubrimiento de un asteroide  (87) Silvia  que tiene dos satlites girando a su alrededor, Rmulo y Remo. Rmulo, la primera luna, se descubri el  18 de febrero  de  2001  en el  telescopio W. M. Keck II  de 10  metros  en Mauna Kea. Tiene 18  km  de dimetro y su rbita, a una distancia de 1370 km de Silvia, tarda en completarse 87,6 horas. Remo, la segunda luna, tiene 7 km de dimetro y gira a una distancia de 710 km, tardando 33 horas en completar una rbita alrededor de Silvia.     El trmino  satlite natural  se contrapone al de  satlite artificial , objeto que giran en torno a la  Tierra , la  Luna  o algunos  planetas  y que ha sido fabricado por el hombre.   Puesto que todos los satlites naturales siguen su rbita debido a la fuerza de  gravedad , el movimiento del objeto primario tambin se ve afectado por el satlite. Es precisamente este fenmeno el que permite el descubrimiento de  planetas extrasolares .   Todas las masas que forman el  Sistema Solar , incluida la  Tierra , son satlites del  Sol , o satlites de esos objetos, como la  Luna . Vase tambin:   Lunas de Haumea   Los planetas  Mercurio  y  Venus  no tienen ningn satlite natural. Sucesivas misiones no tripuladas han aumentado cada cierto tiempo estas cifras al descubrir nuevos satlites, y an pueden hacerlo en el futuro. bed, breaksfast, bed and breakfast, bed und breakfast. Wide beaches, endless oceans, rich flora and fauna. A myriad of colors. Sunshine all the time. Friendly faces. This is your travel destination. This is the Dominican Republic. In the northern part of the island, about 20 minutes from the airport of Puerto Plata, there is a small haven for individual tourists between the settlements Sosoua and Cabarete the Secret Garden. There are 5 brand new carebean colored apartments which shine through to the road through the dense rain forest vegetation. The beautifully arranged and well kept garden is the ideal place for seeking calmness. Only the song of the ocean - a mere 70 m away -, the sound of wind blowing at the palm trees, the humming of lively butterflies and the sound of exotic birds might "disturb" the traveler's peace of mind. The appartments are all equipped equally. Sleeping on the king-size bed is a calming and luxurious feeling. The well equipped kitchen with freezer and cooker offer the comfort of preparing your favorite meals even when you're thousands of miles away from home in the Carebean. After fixing your meal or your cup of coffee you can comfortly sit on your balcony or terrace and sooth your eyes on the turquoise water of the pool in front of the appart-ments. Should you choose to have a rich breakfast with your appartment, then you'll be able to consume it in the palm leaf-topped pavilon next to the pool. After breakfast you can either swim in the pool or you can lay down and enjoy the warm sunshine and the soft wind. You can get to the ocean through a small path, and it is surprising that the beach is almost always empty. The ocean is always warm and is perfect for bathing, diving or other water sports. Long romantic beach walks - or even horseback rides - make your hunger grow. And the best place to eat out are the countless restaurants and cozy cafes at Sosua and Cabarete, both 4 km away from the Secret Garden. There are also numerous big supermarkets that make living in the carebean so much easier. When enjoying the sun gets too boring. The best way to enjoy the country away from tourism! We offer rain forest touring, visiting ancient settlements and sparkling rivers and trips alongside the Caribean shoreland. Riding on the shore from Cabarete to the Secret Garden is fantastic. The Secret Garden is just a quick shorewalk away from Encuentro, the best place for waves on the whole island. A hollow leftwave and a long rightwave make the beach the perfect location for many surfing and windsurfing contests. Surfboards and Boogie Boards can be rented at www.fanatic-cabarete.com. Cabarete offers a number of first class surfschools. Windsurfing conditions are among the best in the world. The Passat usually gets to 4-6 Bft. around noon, and only weakens at sundown. Most windsurfers choose the 2km wide beach of Cabarete that has riffs going into the sea some 800m which create perfect waves. Wind blows sideshore from the right. There are also some secret places for the more experienced surfers. www.fanatic-cabarete.com offers surfboards. You won't miss your favorite sport even while enjoying your holiday in the Dominican Republic. If you're in good condition and don't worry about the plenty of sunshine, then you can choose from 5 sandcourts in Cabarete. It's your choice to have an active or passive holiday with us, because the northern coast of the Dominican Republic offers something for everybody. Be it fishing, kitesurfing, canyoning, golf, motocross or rafting - all these sports are interesting - or a long romantic walk on the ocean shore, a holiday at the Secret Garden offers unforgettable moments. If you don't want to rent a car and don't fancy with the thought of using the Guagua - the typical dominican transportation vehicle - then you can always rent a bike and explore the surroundings. You can rent your bike at the \nSecret Garden too.Sosua and Cabarete offer numerous diving schools. Most diving riffs are located between Sosua and the Secret Garden. Wrecks, underwater caves offer adventurous diving experiences. Offroad quadbikes can take you to the lesser known diving locations. Prices  Studio for two guests per day: 44 US$  Studio for one guest per day: 30 US$  Rich breakfast (even on a per day basis) adult per day: 7 US$ max. 12 year-old child per day: 3 US$ Airport transfer: 10 US$ Children under the age of 12 if they sleep in the same bed with their parents  or on a mattress can stay for free. HELLO. We, as the owners of the Secret Garden would like to introduce ourselves: I am BETTINA, german, and started my carreer as a musician, but after moving to Hungary - a couple of years ago - my professional life became very colorful. One of my favorites was the "sidestep" I took to the tourism industry. My husband and I had a typesetting venture together, where we created proffesional quality books and travel guides. My hobbies are music, reading and traveling JOS, my husband, is hungarian and, among other things, he worked as an engineer in the printing industry until our very stressfull life took a big turn and changed into the quiet and peacufull one it is today. His hobbies are fishing, snorkling and traveling.WE BOTH like nature, sunshine and the sea. We would like to meet lots of interesting people and offer our guests here at the Secret Garden a somewhat different touristical experience. Be our guest and have a wonderfull stay at the Secret Garden! Bettina and Jos Travel: A passport (valid at least 6 months) and a Touristcard are enough. Touristcards are available at the airport before the customs for US$ 10. Health: No shots are mandatory. We recommend foreign health insurance and waterproof sunmilk and insectrepellent.Taxi: The drive from the airport is around US$ 18. Surf bagage is an US$ 5 extra. We provide transfer for only US$ 10. Small busses provide permanent shuttle services between the settlements for a few Pesos. Climate: Tropical climate all year round with 27-32 C (81-89 F). Water temperatures at 28-29 C (82-84 F). 3-day forecast. Passat winds coupled with local thermic  enhancement provide perfect conditions to windsurfers from December to September and present a welcome change to worshipers of the sun. Climate statistics. Language: Spanish. English and german is often understood as well. Contact is easily made to the local dominican inhabitants. Currency: Peso (RD$). We recommend US$, or Euros. No Eurochecks! Creditcards (Visa/Eurocard) are not always accepted. ATM machines provide means of cash retrieval. Dollar-Peso exchange. Electricity: 110V / Secret Garden also provides 220V. 60 HZ. Electric and water shortages are frequent, but the Secret Garden has its own Electric and water generators. Time difference:  -6 hours daylight saving time CET, -5 hours no daylight saving time CET. Restaurants:  Cabarete and Sosoua offer numerous fine restaurants and caf. There you can find everything from fresh fish and various sea foods through pasta meals to vegetarian foods. Only 100 m from the Secret Garden right on the ocean shore is a nice chilean restaurant offering the most deliquate meals at very european prices. Only some 300 m shorewalk away lies the Hotel Breezes all inclusive hotelcomplex where guests of the Secret Garden can dine at reduced prices. This is also true for the national restaurants there, where reserving a table is a must. At the Perla Marina villa-settlement - where the Secret Garden is located - special dominican nights are held with traditional dominican foods, if enough participants are available.  We have grill parties at the Secret Garden as often as our guests desire them. Our guests often cook together. If desired, the owners produce special hungarian dishes as well.Car rental: We can help you get in contact with a very trustable german car rental service. If required the rented car can be available at the airport. Trips:  We offer to help plan every trip you might think of. The Secret Garden is located on the beautiful northern coast of the Dominican Republic, 4 kilo-meters from both Sosua and Cabarete in the very attractive settlement of Perla Marina. It is a 20 minute ride from the air-port in Puerto Plata. Both Ca-barete and Sosua are lively caribean settlements that have plenty of shops, bars, cafes and restaurants, all easily accessible through busses of permanent shuttle services that only cost a few Pesos. On one side there is Cabarete with its joyful inhabitants and very young worldly spirit, and on the other side there is Sosua, which offers lively streets and is perfect for diving or bathing in the Caribean Sea, or for just hanging out. Back at the Secret Garden it is easy to forget the hectics of everyday tou-rist life and to spend a calm and peacefull day.   Weite Strde, endloses Meer, pige Vegetation. Ein Feuerwerk der Farben. Ewige Sonne. Freundliche Gesichter. Das ist Ihr Urlaubsziel. Die Dominikanische Republik. Im Norden der Insel ca. 20 Minuten vom Flughafen Puerto Plata entfernt liegt zwischen den Stten Sosua und Cabarete in der ruhigen Villensiedlung Perla Marina ein Kleinod f alle Individualtouristen der Secret Garden. Von der Strasse nur durch die karibischen Farben der Hser - die durch die tropische Pflanzenwelt hindurchleuchten erkennbar, stehen 5 neu erbaute Gtestudios. Der sch angelegte und gepflegte Garten ist ein Idealplatz f Ruhesuchende. Nur das ewige Lied des Meeres, dass nur 70m von hier entfernt seine Wellen schlt, sowie das Rauschen der Palmenblter, die bunt herumschwirrenden Schmetterlinge und das Singen der exotischen Vel tenhier den Urlauber. Die Studios sind alle gleich ausgestattet. In dem breiten Kingsizebett kann man gemlich ruhen. Eine eingerichtette Khenecke mit Klschrank und Kocher bieten dem kochwigen Urlauber die Mlichkeit auch in der Karibik nicht auf die Lieblingsspeisen von zu Haus verzichten zu msen. Nach der Zubereitung des Men oder des Kaffees kann man gemlich auf der Terasse oder Balkon vor dem Studio mit Blick auf das tkisfarbene Wasser des Pools  - seine Seele baumeln lassen und das karibische Ambi-ente geniessen. Das reichliche Frstk  - wenn gewscht wird unter dem mit Palmenbltern bedeckten Fr-stkspavillion eingenommen. Nach dem Frstk nimmt man dann entweder ein Bad im Pool oder legt sich auf eine der Sonnenliegen und lst sich von Sonne und Wind streicheln. Das Meer ist durch einen kleinen Wildpfad zu erreichen und es errascht den Gast, dass der feine Sandstrand fast immer menschenleer ist. Das stdig warme Wasser des Meeres lt zum Baden, Tauchen oder Wassersport ein. Ausgedehnte, romantische Spaziergge am Strand auch auf dem Rken eines Pferdes - machen Hunger und den kann man am Besten in einer der zahlreichen gemlichen Cafes oder Restaurants in Sosua oder Cabarete, die jeweils ca. 4km von hier entfernt sind, stillen. Hier findet man auch in den grossen Supermkten alles was ein Nichtkaribe zum Leben braucht. Die schste Art das Land abseits des Tourismus zu entdecken! Schon ab einer Person bieten wir Touren durch den Regenwald, durch ursprgliche Dfer und glitzernde Flse, sowie entlang der strandreichen Kte an. Ein Strandritt von Cabarete bis zum Secret Garden ist faszinierend. Die Gtestudios liegen nur einen kurzen Strandspaziergang von Encuentro dem besten Wellenspot der Insel entfernt. Eine hohle Linkswelle und eine lange Rechtswelle machen diesen Strand zum Austragungsort vieler Surf- und Windsurfwettkpfe. Surfboards und Boogieboards verleiht www.fanatic-cabarete.com. In Cabarete gibt es eine grosse Zahl erstklassiger Surfschulen. Die Windsurfbedingungen zlen mit zu den Besten der Welt. Der Passat frischt licherweise gegen Mittag auf 4-6 Bft. auf und schlt erst in der Dmerung wieder ein. Die meisten Surfer findet man am Cabarete-Strand, einer 2km grossen Bucht mit etwa 800m entfernt vorgelagertem Riff, an dem eine hervorragende Welle zum Springen bricht. Der Wind kommt Sideshore von rechts. Auch gute Bedingungen finden Surfer direkt am Secret Garden und in einer Nachbarbucht. Surfausrtung verleiht www.fanatic-cabarete-com. Auch wrend des Urlaubes in der Dominikanischen Republik, msen Sie nicht auf Ihren Lieblingssport verzichten. Wenn Sie gute Kondition besitzen und Ihnen die Sonne nichts ausmacht, knen Sie auf einen der ff excellenten Sandplzen in Cabarete dem Ball nachjagen. Ob Sie einen aktiven oder passiven Urlaub bei uns erleben wollen, liegt alleine an Ihnen, denn die dominikanische Nordkte bietet f jeden etwas. Sei es nun Angeln, Kitesurfen, Canyoning, Golf, Motocross oder Rafting - alle Sportarten haben ihren Reiz - genauso, wie ein stundenlanger Spaziergang an den fast menschenleeren Strden durch seine Romantik unvergessen bleibt. Wer kein Auto mieten mhte und auch mit dem typischen dominikanischen Verkehrsmittel - dem Guagua - nichts im Sinn hat, der kann sich unter tropischer Sonne auf den Drahtesel schwingen und auf zwei Rern die Umgebung erkunden. Mieten kann man Fahrrer u.a. auch im Secret Garden. In Sosua und Cabarete gibt es gleich mehrere Tauchschulen. Die meisten Tauchriffe liegen zwischen Sosua und dem Secret Garden. Abendteuerlich ist ein Wrack, sowie Hlentauchgge oder Ausfle mit Quadbikes offroad zu einsamen, selten betauchten Strden. HALLO, wir sind Eure Gastgeber vom Secret Garden und mhten uns kurz vorstellen: Ich, BETTINA, bin Deutsche und war Musikerin, doch durch meinen Heimatwechsel nach Ungarn vor vielen Jahren hat sich mein Leben beruflich vielftig gestaltet. U. a. gehte ein Ausflug in die Touristikbranche zu meiner schsten Beschtigung. Zuletzt betrieben wir ein Fotosatzstudio, in dem wir anspruchs-volle Fachbher und Reisefrer erstellten. Meine Hobbys sind Musik, Bher und Reisen. JOS, mein Mann, ist Ungar und war Maschinenbauingenieur bevor wir unserem sehr fleissig-gestresstem Leben durch Ausstieg eine frlich-ruhige Wende gaben. Seine Hobbys sind Angeln, Schnorcheln und Reisen. BEIDE  lieben wir die Natur, die Sonne und das Meer. Wir mh-ten viele interessante Menschen kennenlernen und unseren Gten im Secret Garden  den schsten Urlaub weitab vom Null-Acht-Ffzehn-Tourismus bieten.Seid unsere Gte und lasst Euch von uns verwnen! Es grsen Bettina und Janos Einreise: Ein Reisepass (mind. 6 Monate gtig) und eine Touristenkarte genen. Die Touristenkarte ist direkt am Flughafen vor dem Zoll f 10 US$ zu kaufen. Gesundheit: Keine Impfungen vorgeschrieben. Wir empfehlen eine Auslandskrankenversicherung, sowie die Mitnahme von wasserfestem Sonnenschutz und Insektenmittel. Taxi: Die Fahrt vom Flughafen kostet etwa 18 US$. Surfgepk 5 US$ Aufschlag. Wenn Sie von uns Transfer wschen, so kostet Sie das nur 10 US$. Zwischen den Orten verkehren permanent Kleinbusse f wenige Pesos. Klima:  ganzjrig tropisches Klima mit 27-32 Grad Celsius. Wasser herrliche 28-29 Grad Celsius. 5 tige Vorhersage. Von Dezember bis September erfreuen zuverlsige Passatwinde mit lokaler Thermikverstkung die Windsurfer und sorgen f angenehme Erfrischung der Sonnenanbeter. Klimastatistik.Sprache: Spanisch. Hfig wird auch Englisch und Deutsch verstanden. Abseits des All Inclusive-Tourismus findet man schnell Kontakt zur freundlichen dominikanischen Bevkerung. Zahlungsmittel: Landeswrung Peso (RD$). Empfohlen wird die Mitnahme von US$, oder Euro. Keine Euroschecks! Kreditkarten (Visa/Eurocard) werden nicht immer akzeptiert. Es ist aber mlich mit Bankkarten am Automaten Geld zu holen. Euro-Peso Umrechnung. Strom: 110V/ im Secret Garden auch 220V. 60 HZ. Strom- und Wasserausfle sind hfig, doch durch einen eigenen Stromgenerator und eine  Wasserzisterne ist der Secret Garden weitgehends geschzt. Zeitunterschied:  -5 Stunden im Winter und -6 Stunden im Sommer. Restaurants: In Cabarete und Sosua findet man zahlreiche gemliche Restaurants und Cafes. Von frischem Fisch, Meeresfrhten, Fleisch, Pasta bis hin zu vegetarianischen Gerichten findet man hier alles was der Gaumen begehrt. 100m vom Secret Garden entfernt liegt ein chilenisches Restaurant direkt am Strand, mit den feinsten Gerichten zu allerdings europschen Preisen. Secret Garden (= Jard Secreto) - por la recomendaci de los que conocen la Republica Dominicana Playas extensas, mar infinito, vegetaci abundente. Una mezcla de colores diversos. Sol eterno. Caras amables. Este es su destino de las vacaciones, la Republica Dominicana. A la norte de la isla, a veinte minutos del aeropuerto Puerto Plata, entre las ciudades Sosua y Cabarete, en el tranquilo parque de villas "Perla Marina" se encuentra el Secret Garden, una perla para las turistas que desean experiencias especiales. Los 5 apartamentos nuevos desde la calle, so se puede reconocer por sus colores del caribe atrav de la vegetaci tropical. El jard bonito y cultivado espera a los que buscan tranquilidad. Solamente el murmullo infinito del oceano a una distancia de 70 metros, el susurro de las ojas de las palmeras, las mariposas coloradas y la canci de los paros exicos est "molestando" a las turistas. Los apartamentos son amueblados en la misma manera. En las camas grandes se punde descansar confortablemente. Una pequa cocina bien equipada hace posible a las turistas preparar sus comidas preferidas en casa. Despu de preparar la comida o un cafse puede pasar el tiempo agradablemente en el balc o en la terraza dalante del apartamiento, cuales dan a la piscina de color azul turqu lo gue nos ofrece un ambiente caribe. A quien desea el desayuno abundente, lo servimos en un pabell cubierto por ojas de palmera. Despu del desayuno se puede ba?ar en la piscina o disfrutarse el acaricio de la brisa y del sol en una hamaca. Se puede llegar al mar por un camino peque?o y suele sorprender al turista que la playa de arena fina es generalmente desierta. El agua caliente del mar siempre nos invita a ba?as, ba?ar o a distintos deportes aquicos. Los paseos largos por la playa - algunas veces montando a caballo - pueden causar mucha hambre, que se puede calmar en los bares y restaurantes de Sosua y Cabarete (a 4 kms de aqu. En los supermercados se puede encontrar todo lo que necesita en la vida. Cuando nos aburrimos del ba?o de sol Montar a caballo La manera m bonita de descubrir las partes del pa todav intactas por el turismo. Ya para somamente una persona organizamos caminos a la selva, atrav de los pueblos de los aborenes y a lo largo de rs brillantes y costas LLenas de playas. Es una experiencia fanttica pasear a caballo desde Cabarete hasta el Secret Garden. Surfing El Secret Garden esta una distancia de un paseo corto, a lo largo de la playa, del "Encuentro", que es un lugar perfecto para el deporte de las olas en la isla. Gracias a una ola hueca de la izquierda y una ola larga de la derecha se organiza en esta playa un mont de competiciones de surf y windsurf. Equipos se puede alquilar tambi del www.fanatic-cabarete.com. Windsurfing En Cabarete, en muchas partes se ense?a el surf de una nivel muy alto. Las condiciones del windsurfing aquson mas de las mejores en el mundo. Generalment el viento se hace m fuerte, unos 4-6 bft, a mediod, y solamente va a calmasse al anochecer. La mayor de los que practican el windsurf se puede ver en la playa de Cabarete en una bahia de 2 kms, a lo largo de un anecife a 800 mr de  la costa donde exelentemente se rompean las olas. La direcci del viento es de derecha. Para los profesionales hay lugares icos que puedea causarles sorpresa. Equipos se puede alquilar del www.fanatic-cabarete.com. Vacaci de aventuras Que quiere pasar su vacaci activa o pasivamente, eso so depende en usted, porque la costa del norte de la Replica Dominicana le ofrece todo. Todos los deportes - desde pescar kitesurfing, canyoning, golf, motocros, hasta rafting - sienen su fuerza atractiva, en le mismo manera que un largo paseo romtico inolvidable en la costa. Bruceo En Sosua y Cabarete hay numerosas escuelas de submarimismo. La mayor parte de los arrecifes para el buceo se encuentra entre Sosua y el Secret Garden. Mirar un naufragado, una cueva o visitar una playa abandonada con quadbikes offroad punde ser una excursi de muchas aventuras. Bicicleta Si no tiene ganas de alquilar un coche y tampoco quiere ir con la guagua - medio de transporte tico en la Replica Dominicana - puede montar a una bici y bajo del sol tropical puede explorar los alrededores. Se puede alquilar bicicletas en el Secret Garden tambi. Tenis No tiene que quitarse su costumbre preferida de jugar al tenis. Si tiene buena condici fica y no le molesta el sol, usted puede comer a la  pelota en una de las cinco pistas de tenis en Cabarete. Precios Estudio doble (para 2 persones)/d: 44 USD  Estudio solo (para una persona)/d: 30 USD Desayuna abundente (se puede pedirlo en cada d) adulto/d: 7 USD Ni?os hasta la edad de 12/d: 3 USD Transfer al aeropuerto: 10 USD Para los ni?os hasta la edad de 12 - en la misma habitaci con los padres - el alojamiento es de gratis. Foglal = ocupaci Dde se encuenta el Secret Garden? Estsituado en la pintoresca costa al norte de la Replica Dominicana, entre los centros turticos Sosua y Cabarete a 5 km de  cada uno en medio del condominio Perla Marina. Del aeropuerto internacional de Puerto Plata esta 20 minutos en coche. Pagando solamente unos Pesos Dominicanos se puede subir a uno de los carros plicos que le llevan al pasajero hasta Sosua o Cabarete. Vitales pueblos y ticamente caribe?os con una gran gama de tiendas, bares y restaurantes. Cabarete atrae al visitante por su originalidad, la gente amable y por su ambiente juvenil por un lado y Sosua por su gran gama de actividades ofrecidas, paseos por las calles vitales, tures de esnorquel y buceo o un ba?o en el agua cristalina. Vuelto al Secret Garden se goza la tranquilidad y el silencio fuera de la turbulenta vida turtica. direcci: Perla Maria , Paseo las Perlas 20. Hola! Deseamos  introducirnos como los anfitriones del Secret Garden: Yo, Bettina soy alemana y era flautista, sin embargo por el cambio de mi patria a Hungria - muchos a?os ant - mi vida profesional se ha resultado variada. Una de mis ocupaciones preferidas fue la "excursi" en el terreno del turismo. Ultimamente trabajamos en un estudio de fotocomposici, donde  hemos producido libros especializados  y gus de nivel alto. Mis pasatiempos preferidos son: mica, libros y viajar. Jos, mi marido es hgaro y entre otros fue ingeniero mecico hasta que nuestra vida llena de mucho trabajo y de estr, diuna vuelta alegre y tranquila. Sus pasatiempos preferidos son pescar con ca?a, bucar, viajar. Ambos amamos la naturaleza, el sol y el mar. Qusieramos conocer a muchas personas interesantes y ofrecer a nuestros hupedes en el Secret Garden un pasatiempo agradable y ico, algo diferente. ue sean nuestros invitados y nos dejen minas a ustedes! Saludos, Bettina y Jos Informaciones generales Entrada: Se necesita un pasaporte (vido por lo menos 6 meses m), una  tarjeta turtica que se puede comprar en el aeropuerto antes de pasar la aduana, cuesta 20 USD Sanidad: En cuanto a las vacuanaciones no hay reglemento. Recomeadamos un seguro de enfermedad para la estancia en el extranjero, adem crema bronceada y remedio contra los insectos. Taxi:  Un viaje desde el aeropuerto cuesta unos 18 USD, para el equipaje de surf 5 USD m. Si usted desea nuestra transfer, cuesta 10 USD. Entre los pueblos siempre cruzan las guaguas, que son baratas. Clima: El clima es tropical y todo el a?o hay 27-32 grados celsius. Hay predicci para 5 ds. Hace viento alo desde diciembre hasta septiembre, que es bueno para los que practican el windsurf y al mismo tiempo da un refresco para los adoradores del sol. Estattica del cla. Idioma: Espa?ol. Se entiende el ingl y el alem tambi. Aparte del turismo todo incluido se puede hecer contacto filmente con los dominicanos amables. Moneda oficial: moneda del pa: peso dominicano (RD$). Es recomendable llevar US$ o Euro. No cheque de Euro. No se acepta el Visa/Eurocard enmuchas partes. Pero es posible sacar dinero con creditcard en el cajero automico. Euro-Peso cambio. Alimentaci eltrica: 110V/60Hz - en el Secret Garden hay 220V tambi. A pesar de la falta frequente de la luz o agua el Secret Garden estdefendido por su pria planta y cisterna. Deferencia del tiempo: -5 horas en el invierno y -6 horas en el verano. Restaurantes: En Cabarete y Sosua podemos encontrar numerosas restaurantes agradables. Aqunosofrecen pescados, mariscos, carne, pasta, platos vegetales tambi - todo lo que le gusta al turista.A 100 metros del Secret Garden se hallun restaurante chile?o con platos riquimos, pero de prio europeo. A un paseo de 300 metros en la costa se encuentra el Hotel Breezes, donde los hupedes del Secret Garden pueden recibir precios especiales para la corrida en el restaurante. Aqu y en otros restaurantes tambi hay que reservar la mesa. En Perla Marina, - donde se hallel Secret Garden tambi - en cuanto hay bastante participaci, se organizan "noches dominicanas" con platos especiales. En el Secret Garden solemos hacer "noches de grill" si nuestros hupedes requieren. Es posible cocinar juntos con nuestros hupedes, y se puede conocer y probar las especialidades de la ama de casa. Alquilar coche: ayudamos en gratis a encontrar alquiladores fiables alemenes. Ya es posible recibir el coche en el aeropuerto tambi. Excursiones: Ayudamos con mucho gusto en orgnizar excursiones de todos tipos. Avi: El aeropuerto destino: Puerto Plata.
